author: BBC News
description:
There is a new deal on the table for American universities. 

After months of battles between the Trump administration and some of America’s top universities, over access to funding and changes to admissions process, there is a new deal on the table. 

The White House is asking nine elite colleges to agree to President Trump’s vision for American campuses in exchange for  “substantial and meaningful federal grants”.

The White House says it will tackle elitism and racial bias but opponents of the deal say it limits the very thing that Trump says he wants free speech.  

Justin and Anthony speak to Inez Stepman, Senior Policy and Legal Analyst for the Independent Women’s Forum and Independent Women’s Law Centre, to get an inside view into the administration’s position on universities. 

HOSTS: 
• Justin Webb, Radio 4 presenter
• Anthony Zurcher, North America Correspondent
title: The fight for the future of U.S universities | BBC Americast

author: BBC News
description:
The ceasefire agreement with Hamas in Gaza has come into force. The partial withdrawal of Israeli forces from the territory triggered a mass return of people back to shattered towns and villages, but the Israeli Defence Forces still remain in control of half of Gaza.
 
In a matter of hours as many as 200,000 Palestinians had begun making the long journey on foot, back to the places that were their homes, after being displaced by the fighting.

In Israel, the friends and families of surviving hostages have been speaking about their relief that a ceasefire deal is in place and their hopes of being reunited with their loved ones within days.

The ceasefire came into effect after being approved by the Israeli government. Under the deal, Israel pulled back its troops to agreed positions in Gaza. However, the IDF says it will "continue to remove any immediate threat".
 
The withdrawal triggered a 72-hour countdown to midday on Monday, by which time Hamas must release the remaining 20 living
title: Gaza ceasefire - 200,000 Palestinians head back to shattered homes after two years of war | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
President Emmanuel Macron has asked Sébastien Lecornu to return as French prime minister only four days after he stood down from the post.

Macron made the announcement late on Friday, hours after meeting all the main parties together at the Élysée Palace, except the leaders of the far right and far left.
 
Lecornu's return came as a surprise, as he said on national TV only two days ago he was not "chasing the job" and his "mission is over".
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#France #EmmanuelMacron #BBCNews
title: Macron reappoints Lecornu as French PM, fours days after his resignation | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Thousands of Palestinians have begun returning to Gaza's north, as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu thanked US President Donald Trump for securing a ceasefire. 
 
It comes as the IDF says its forces have pulled back to the lines agreed under Trump's plan, but will continue to "remove any immediate threat.”
 
There’s still a long way to go before a full peace is reached – and a mammoth rebuilding job amid the destruction in Gaza.
 
The Security Brief Presenter Christian Fraser is joined by former British military strategic planner Mikey Kay, as they take a look at what a lasting peace looks like, and what will be required to ensure Gaza’s long-term security.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 
 
#Gaza #Israel #BBCNews
title: The Security Brief: How will Trump’s Gaza plan be implemented? | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
A massive blast at a military explosives facility in Tennessee has left several people dead and others missing, officials say.
 
At least 19 people are unaccounted for following the explosion, according to a local affiliate of CBS News.
 
Aerial video from the scene in Hickman, south-west of Nashville, shows charred debris scattered around the area and little remaining of the facility.
 
The explosion just before 08:00 local time on Friday was heard from miles away including in neighbouring counties, reports say.
 
There is a huge emergency response at the scene, with one first responder telling the Associated Press they could not enter the site initially due to continuing detonations.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Tennessee #BBCNews
title: Massive blast at Tennessee explosives plant leaves several dead and others missing | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Palestinians are beginning to return to Gaza's north as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu thanks Donald Trump for securing a ceasefire.
 
Forces have pulled back to the lines agreed under Trump's plan, the IDF says, but will continue to "remove any immediate threat".
 
Hamas has until 12:00 local time on Monday to release all Israeli hostages, while Israel will release hundreds of Palestinian detainees.
 
It comes after the Israeli government approved the first phase of Trump's ceasefire and hostage return deal.
 
Under the deal, aid trucks are expected to start surging in to help Gaza's two million people, most of whom have been displaced.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Gaza #Israel #BBCNews
title: Palestinians begin returning to Gaza's north | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
A decade ago, BBC journalist Danny Vincent documented a North Korean family’s 3,000-kilometre journey to freedom. 

If caught, they faced almost certain death. They risked all to reunited with their loved one in the South. 

Today the number of North Korean defectors escaping the country has dropped dramatically. 

Escapees speak of increased ideological control and a shoot to kill policy at the border. 

Ten years on we go back to meet the Park family as they retell the story of their daring escape and their new life in South Korea. 

The film has some scenes some viewers may find upsetting.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews
title: A North Korean family's life 10 years after their escape | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelensky has claimed that Russia is using its oil tankers to launch reconnaissance operations across Europe. 

His comments follow multiple reports of drone sightings in Germany, as discussions over how to adequately reinforce Nato airspace continue. But what evidence is there that Russia is responsible for these apparent incursions, as the Kremlin points the finger at Ukraine?

On this episode Jamie Coomarasamy and Vitaly Shevchenko are joined by Ukraine correspondent James Waterhouse and BBC Verify’s Olga Robinson to answer your questions. 

What would a drone wall look like? How can Europe win round Hungary's Viktor Orbán? And could Ukraine’s allies deploy soldiers to the frontline?

Listen to the full episode here: https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/p0m7pqdh 

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog 

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
#ukraine  #Russia #BBCNews
title: Is Russia using its 'shadow fleet' to launch surveillance drones? | BBC Ukrainecast

author: BBC News
description:
Today, how has the Israel-Gaza war changed UK politics?

As momentum builds around a potential ceasefire agreement Adam, Chris and Dharshini are joined by Sarah Montague, presenter of the World At One.

Plus, they discuss whether Kemi Badenoch has changed approach and if it’ll work? And, the prime minister’s trip to India.
title: Was this the week UK politics changed? | BBC Newscast

author: BBC News
description:
A pioneer of clean energy, Denmark is now racing to produce more climate-friendly fuels that could power ships, aircraft and industry.
 
Green methanol is a fuel with a low net carbon footprint - and an ingredient for plastics, paint and glue. 
 
Reporting for BBC Tech Now, Adrienne Murray is in Denmark to see the world’s first commercial scale plant making green methanol.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews
title: What is green methanol? | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky says Russia has targeted the country with 450 drones and 30 missiles overnight, targeting the energy sector and causing power outages in nine regions.

In Kyiv, nine people were injured while residents in eastern districts were plunged into darkness and faced disruption to water supplies, the city's mayor Vitali Klitschko said.

Meanwhile, a seven-year-old child was killed in a separate Russian drone strike in the Zaporizhzhia area in the country's south-east, according to the Ukrainian regional head.

Moscow has escalated attacks on energy facilities over recent weeks, while Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has called for "real steps" from allies to apply pressure to Russia.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews
title: Russia launched 450 drones on Ukraine overnight, Zelensky says | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
The Israeli military has said a ceasefire is now in effect after its forces pulled back to parts of Gaza.

Troops have positioned themselves along the lines agreed under the Trump plan, the IDF says - but will continue to "remove any immediate threat".

It comes after the Israeli government approved a deal with Hamas which will also see the release of hostages.

Hamas now has 72 hours to release all Israeli hostages, while Israel will release hundreds of Palestinian detainees.

Once the deal is operating, aid trucks will surge in to help Gaza's two million people, most of whom have been displaced.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Gaza #Israel #BBCNews
title: Israeli military says ceasefire in effect after pulling back from parts of Gaza | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
A 7.4 magnitude earthquake struck off the southern coast of Philippines, prompting tsunami warnings from Philippine and Indonesian authorities.

Residents in coastal towns in central and southern Philippines were asked to evacuate as authorities warned of waves over a metre (3.3ft) above normal tide levels.

At least one person was killed in the earthquake on Friday morning, which also led to power cuts and classes being suspended in parts of the country.

The latest tremor comes just over a week after a 6.9 magnitude quake hit Philippine's central Cebu province, killing 74 people and injuring hundreds.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Earthquake #Philippines #BBCNews
title: Strong 7.4 magnitude earthquake hits southern Philippines | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
The winner of this year's Nobel Peace Prize is Venezuelan democracy campaigner Maria Corina Machado.
 
She has been recognised "for her tireless work promoting democratic rights for the people of Venezuela" and "her struggle to achieve a just and peaceful transition from dictatorship to democracy".
 
US President Donald Trump had led a public campaign to win the award, but nominations closed in January - at the start of his second term in office.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#NobelPeacePrize #MariaCorinaMachado #BBCNews
title: Venezuelan democracy activist Maria Corina Machado wins Nobel Peace Prize | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Israel has approved the Gaza ceasefire and hostage release plan, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office says in a statement.

The ceasefire is due to come into force early on Saturday, 24 hours after the deal was approved.

The US is moving up to 200 troops already based in the Middle East to co-ordinate a multinational force that will monitor the ceasefire, US officials say. 
US President Donald Trump says Israeli hostages could be released on "Monday or Tuesday”.

As well as the ceasefire and hostages, the first phase of an agreement would also see Israel release hundreds of Palestinian prisoners; Israeli troops beginning to withdraw from parts of Gaza; and hundreds of trucks of aid a day entering Gaza.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews
title: Israel approves Donald Trump’s plan for Gaza ceasefire and hostage release | BBC News
